panels.description: Total usable space in bytes, not including WAFL reserve and aggregate Snapshot copy reserve.
panels.title: Total Space

panels.description: Percent of space used.
panels.title: Space Used %

panels.description:
Object Count.

Note: The REST and ZAPI collectors return a different number of volumes depending on whether you have set up object store servers on your cluster. 

For more details, visit the [ZAPI and REST Gaps](https://netapp.github.io/harvest/latest/zapi-and-rest-gap.md).
panels.title: Object Count

panels.description: Available space.
panels.title: Available Space

panels.description: Space used or reserved in bytes. Includes volume guarantees and aggregate metadata.
panels.title: Used and Reserved Space

panels.description: Total usable space in bytes, not including WAFL reserve and aggregate Snapshot copy reserve.

targets.expr:
sum by (netapp_cluster) (aggr_space_total{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"})
and
  topk(
    $TopResources,
    sum by (netapp_cluster) (
      avg_over_time(aggr_space_total{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"}[3h] @ end())
    )
  )

panels.title: Top $TopResources Total Space by Cluster

panels.description: Space used or reserved in bytes. Includes volume guarantees and aggregate metadata.

targets.expr:
sum by (netapp_cluster) (aggr_space_used{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"})
and
  topk(
    $TopResources,
    sum by (netapp_cluster) (
      avg_over_time(aggr_space_used{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"}[3h] @ end())
    )
  )

panels.title: Top $TopResources Used and Reserved Space by Cluster

panels.description: Available space.

targets.expr:
sum by (netapp_cluster) (aggr_space_available{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"})
and
  topk(
    $TopResources,
    sum by (netapp_cluster) (
      avg_over_time(aggr_space_available{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"}[3h] @ end())
    )
  )

panels.title: Top $TopResources Available Space by Cluster

panels.description: Percent of space used.

targets.expr:
(
      100 * sum by (datacenter, netapp_cluster) (aggr_space_used{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"})
    / on (datacenter, netapp_cluster)
      sum by (datacenter, netapp_cluster) (aggr_space_total{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"})
  )
and on (datacenter, netapp_cluster)
  topk(
    $TopResources,
    (
          100
        *
          sum by (datacenter, netapp_cluster) (
            avg_over_time(aggr_space_used{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"}[3h] @ end())
          )
      / on (datacenter, netapp_cluster)
        sum by (datacenter, netapp_cluster) (
          avg_over_time(aggr_space_total{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"}[3h] @ end())
        )
    )
  )

panels.title: Top $TopResources Space Used % by Cluster

panels.description: Cluster Health Details.

panels.description: Node details.
panels.title: Node Health

options.content:
These panels require ONTAP 9.6+ and the REST collector. Two actions are required to use this dashboard:
1. Enable the REST collector in your harvest.yml config
2. Enable the EMS collector in your harvest.yml config for EMS events
For more information on the issues, please check the `ONTAP: Health` dashboard.

panels.description: This panel displays error detail of disk, shelf, node, network port, license compliance, HA down and sensor failure alerts.

targets.expr:
(
      count(
        health_network_fc_port_alerts{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",severity="error"} == 1
      )
    or
      vector(0)
  )
+
  (
      count(
          health_network_ethernet_port_alerts{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",severity="error"}
        ==
          1
      )
    or
      vector(0)
  )

panels.title: Errors

panels.description: This panel displays warning detail of disk, shelf, health monitor, lif, volume move and volume anti-ransomware alerts.

targets.legendFormat: Lif are not at home port

panels.title: Warnings

panels.description: $EMSDescription
panels.title: Active Emergency EMS

panels.description: Average latency in microseconds for the WAFL filesystem to process all the operations on the volume; not including request processing or network communication time.

targets.expr:
max by (netapp_cluster) (volume_avg_latency{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"})
and
  topk(
    $TopResources,
    max by (netapp_cluster) (
      avg_over_time(volume_avg_latency{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"}[3h] @ end())
    )
  )

panels.title: Top $TopResources Latency by Cluster

    )
  )

panels.title: Top $TopResources Throughput by Cluster

options.content: For more information, please check the `ONTAP: Data Protection Snapshots` dashboard.

panels.description: Volumes Protected With Snapshot Copies (local). For more information, please check the `ONTAP: Data Protection Snapshots` dashboard.

targets.expr:
count(
      volume_labels{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",snapshot_policy!="",snapshot_policy!~"none.*",volume!~"MDV.*"}
    * on (snapshot_policy) group_left ()
      group by (snapshot_policy) (snapshot_policy_labels)
  )
or on ()
  vector(0)

panels.title: Protected Status

panels.description: Volumes Breaching Snapshot Copy Reserve Space.For more information, please check the `ONTAP: Data Protection Snapshots` dashboard.

targets.expr:
count(
        volume_labels{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",snapshot_policy!="",snapshot_policy!~"none.*"}
      * on (snapshot_policy) group_left ()
        group by (snapshot_policy) (snapshot_policy_labels)
    * on (volume, svm, netapp_cluster) group_right ()
      (
            volume_snapshot_reserve_size{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"} >= 0
          and
            volume_snapshots_size_used{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"} >= 0
        and
            volume_snapshots_size_used{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"}
          >
            volume_snapshot_reserve_size{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"}
      )
  )
or on ()
  vector(0)

(
      count(
          (
              volume_labels{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",snapshot_policy!="",snapshot_policy!~"none.*"}
            * on (snapshot_policy) group_left ()
              group by (snapshot_policy) (snapshot_policy_labels)
          )
        * on (volume, svm, netapp_cluster) group_right ()
          (
                volume_snapshot_reserve_size{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"} >= 0
              and
                volume_snapshots_size_used{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"} >= 0
            and
                volume_snapshots_size_used{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"}
              <=
                volume_snapshot_reserve_size{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"}
          )
      )
    or on ()
      vector(0)
  )
+
  (
      count(
            volume_labels{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",snapshot_policy!="",snapshot_policy!~"none.*"}
          * on (snapshot_policy) group_left ()
            group by (snapshot_policy) (snapshot_policy_labels)
        * on (volume, svm, netapp_cluster) group_right ()
          (
              volume_snapshot_reserve_size{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"} >= 0
            and
              volume_snapshots_size_used{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"} == 0
          )
      )
    or on ()
      vector(0)
  )

panels.title: Breached Status

panels.description: For more information, please check the `ONTAP: Data Protection Snapshots` dashboard.

targets.expr:
count(
      (
          volume_labels{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",snapshot_policy!="",snapshot_policy!~"none.*",volume!~"MDV.*"}
        * on (snapshot_policy) group_left ()
          group by (snapshot_policy) (snapshot_policy_labels{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"})
      )
    * on (volume, svm, netapp_cluster)
      (
          volume_snapshot_count{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"} > 0
        and
          volume_snapshot_count{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"} < 10
      )
  )
or on ()
  vector(0)

count(
      (
          volume_labels{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",snapshot_policy!="",snapshot_policy!~"none.*",volume!~"MDV.*"}
        * on (snapshot_policy) group_left ()
          group by (snapshot_policy) (snapshot_policy_labels{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"})
      )
    * on (volume, svm, netapp_cluster)
      (
          volume_snapshot_count{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"} >= 10
        and
          volume_snapshot_count{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"} <= 100
      )
  )
or on ()
  vector(0)

count(
      (
          volume_labels{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",snapshot_policy!="",snapshot_policy!~"none.*",volume!~"MDV.*"}
        * on (snapshot_policy) group_left ()
          group by (snapshot_policy) (snapshot_policy_labels{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"})
      )
    * on (volume, svm, netapp_cluster)
      (
          volume_snapshot_count{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"} > 100
        and
          volume_snapshot_count{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"} <= 500
      )
  )
or on ()
  vector(0)

count(
      (
          volume_labels{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter",snapshot_policy!="",snapshot_policy!~"none.*",volume!~"MDV.*"}
        * on (snapshot_policy) group_left ()
          group by (snapshot_policy) (snapshot_policy_labels{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"})
      )
    * on (volume, svm, netapp_cluster)
      (volume_snapshot_count{netapp_cluster=~"$Cluster",datacenter=~"$Datacenter"} > 500)
  )
or on ()
  vector(0)

panels.description: Detail cluster information with links to System Manager.
panels.title: System Manager

current.text: System CPU resource utilization is a computed percentage that indicates how busy the system is based on a combination of the most heavily utilized domain and idle CPU cycles. This metric determines the amount of available CPU and will vary based on domains reaching their limits OR exhausting all idle CPU cycles, whichever comes first.
current.value: System CPU resource utilization is a computed percentage that indicates how busy the system is based on a combination of the most heavily utilized domain and idle CPU cycles. This metric determines the amount of available CPU and will vary based on domains reaching their limits OR exhausting all idle CPU cycles, whichever comes first.
